channel.title: Comments on: Want To Build Win8/WinJS Apps? You Need To Understand Promises.

item.title: By: Andi
item.dc:creator: Andi
item.description: How did you managed to get rid of the promise chains?
item.content:encoded: How did you managed to get rid of the promise chains?

item.title: By: kamranayub
item.dc:creator: kamranayub
item.description: As soon as you start to write a repository/class for going against a service, Promises are your best friend.
item.content:encoded: As soon as you start to write a repository/class for going against a service, Promises are your best friend.

item.title: By: CameronW
item.dc:creator: CameronW
item.description: It kind of reminds me of the Task class from the .NET Task Parallel Library... Specifically the Task.ContinueWith() method. IMO I think Task is a more suitable name/concept than Promise..
item.content:encoded:
It kind of reminds me of the Task class from the .NET Task Parallel Library…
Specifically the Task.ContinueWith() method. IMO I think Task is a more suitable name/concept than Promise..

item.description: is there a repo to follow along?
item.content:encoded: is there a repo to follow along?
